Interface CommanderInterface

All Superinterfaces:
LoggingInterface
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseCommander
public interface CommanderInterface extends LoggingInterface
To read commands from outside of app, use readCommandsFromTextFile(File), which can be scheduled with your flow manager. Commands can be defined with CommandInterface as enums and parsed through executeCommand(CommandInterface, List).

Commands parsing patterns

  • The first word separated by any number of space chars is a command, parsable as CommandInterface.
  • Strings following the command are recognised as argument-value pairs. The spacing does not influence the pattern recognition.
  • Unmatched pairs, null, quoted or bracketed, and the -- arg - all are treated as empty arguments (they hold no assigned value information, will return null).
  • Value is assigned using any number of following characters: space, = or :.
  • Enquoted args do not permit quote characters within (they close the pattern).
  • Bracketed args allow of usage any character within, including other brackets (the last bracket closes the pattern).
  • The -- arg escapes any pattern parsing for any string put after.
  • Single and double quotes, different brackets - are not distinguished.
  • - and -- as prefixes are treated with no difference. Args get stripped from these when parsing. Using dashes for arguments make the parse error-proof and values assignments clear.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      static Optional<CommanderInterface> getInstance()

    • executeCommand

      boolean executeCommand(CommandInterface command, List<String> arguments)
      Implement the execution of given command and arguments. Using switch with enum implementing CommandInterface is advised.
      Returns:
      Boolean - true if the command was correctly parsed (irrespectively to the outcome), false if not found or errored. Susceptible to custom interpretation.

    • readCommandsFromTextFile

      default void readCommandsFromTextFile(File commandsFile)
      Read file lines passed and perform executeCommand(CommandInterface, List) on each.

    • parseCommand

      default boolean parseCommand(String command)
      First trimmed word is a command, case-insensitive, followed by arguments with "--" or "-".
